subject: p13263843
History: -year-old female patient with right lower lobe collapse post-bronchoscopy, assess interval change.
Findings: AP single view of the chest has been obtained in this patient with semi-upright position. Analysis is performed in direct comparison with the next preceding portable chest examination of. Status post right upper lobectomy unchanged. Cardiac enlargement as before may have even increased slightly. On previous examination identified small caliber pigtail end catheter in the right lateral pleural sinus is still present. The amount of pleural fluid density has increased mildly. No pneumothorax has developed. Overall increased hazy appearance of the lung bases coinciding with perivascular haze in the pulmonary vessels is suggestive of increased CHF in this patient. No new discrete local parenchymal infiltrates suggestive of pneumonia are identified.
